docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (13, 49) WILL FERRELL: THE MARK TWAIN PRIZE Mr. Ferrell, above, the 14th recipient of the Mark Twain Prize for American Humor, is honored at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington in this ceremony taped on Oct. 23. Among those cheering Mr. Ferrell -- whose career has traversed the Groundlings improv group, ''Saturday Night Live'' and films like ''Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby,'' ''Blades of Glory,'' and ''Everything Must Go'' -- are colleagues and friends like Billie Joe Armstrong of Green Day, Ed Asner, Jack Black, Matthew Broderick, Gwen Ifill, Adam McKay, Tim Meadows, Conan O'Brien, John C. Reilly, Paul Rudd, Andy Samberg, Molly Shannon and Ben Stiller. ''Before Will a man in his boxers was considered funny,'' Mr. O'Brien said, explaining Mr. Ferrell's appeal. ''But sometime in the '90s Will raised the bar and appeared in tight, unflattering briefs. It was a paradigm shift, a cosmic break, and comedy has never been the same.'' 1 A.M. (TV Land) ROSEANNE'S WICKED HALLOWEEN BASH Five hours of some of the spookiest episodes of ''Roseanne,'' including a spoof of ''Rosemary's Baby'' that starred Marlo Thomas, Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley.

docs.abstract: In a nation where hunting and meat eating are idealized, affection between humans and animals is seen as a type of illness.
docs.snippet: In a nation where hunting and meat eating are idealized, affection between humans and animals is seen as a type of illness.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a 1991 interview titled "Eating Well," Jacques Derrida wonders whether a head of state (chef d'Etat) could gain office by declaring himself or herself a vegetarian.  He concludes, "The chief (chef) must be an eater of flesh."
docs.abstract: In a nation where hunting and meat eating is idealized, affection between humans and animals is seen as a type of illness.

docs.lead_paragraph: An exhibit around a live birth has drawn news cameras to a Brooklyn gallery that has quickly won a reputation for taking chances on emerging artists and keeping ties to older pioneers.

headline.seo: Birth Brings Attention to Microscope Gallery
headline.main: For a Gallery at the Edge, Fame Is Born Tuesday
headline.print_headline: For a Gallery at the Edge, Fame Is Born Tuesday

docs.abstract: The Birth of Baby X, exhibit during which performance artist Marni Kotak gave birth before an audience of 15, has drawn attention to Microscope Gallery in Bushwick, Brooklyn; gallery has won a reputation for taking chances on emerging artists and keeping ties to older pioneers.
docs.snippet: An exhibit around a live birth has drawn news cameras to a Brooklyn gallery that has quickly won a reputation for taking chances on emerging artists and keeping ties to older pioneers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Patriots (5-1) at Steelers (5-2) Sunday, 4:15 p.m. Line: Patriots by 3. In a world where the Colts lose by 55 points, the Jaguars can beat the Ravens without scoring a touchdown and games are becoming so boring that they have become upstaged by the postgame handshakes, it is heartening to know that we can still count on the Steelers' defense. Unfortunately, we cannot still count on the Steelers' defense. The Steelers have intercepted just two passes this season, an amazingly low figure when you run down the quarterbacks they have faced: Tarvaris Jackson, Blaine Gabbert, Kevin Kolb, Kerry Collins, Curtis Painter. Ten of the Steelers' 17 sacks came against Gabbert and Jackson, the standard-bearers in that cavalcade of regret. While Warren Sapp's ''old and slow'' estimation of the Steelers' defense after Week 1 was premature and slightly exaggerated, the Steel Curtain now has a higher-than-advertised aluminum content. The Steelers compensate for their declining defense with one of the best passing attacks in the league: they rank fifth in net passing yards per game and eighth in yards per attempt. And while the Patriots' offense is better than Pittsburgh's, their defense is far worse, allowing a league-high 423 yards per game. So get ready for a back-and-forth, high-scoring offensive battle. After last week's games, you deserve it. Pick: Steelers.
